data.title: Willamette University
data.text:
Videos

Video Archive

From Barney to Blitz, what is a Bearcat? The history of the Willamette University Bearcat mascot.

For Kimber Mattox '11, Willamette felt like family Kimber Mattox '11 was inducted into the Willamette Athletic Hall of Fame on Saturday June 11, 2022

For Ryan Hepp '03, nothing elicits passion and desire like playing for Willamette. Ryan Hepp '03 was inducted into the Willamette Athletic Hall of Fame on Saturday, June 11, 2022

Congratulations Mike Allegre on your retirement After several decades as the voice of the Bearcats, Mike Allegre will call his last pair of basketball games on February 18, 2022

Carpenter Scores 31 on Play for ABTA Night Amanda Carpenter (Grad., G, Beaverton, OR/Sunset HS) scored a career-high 31 points to lead Willamette University to a 70-50 victory over Linfield University on Play for ABTA night at Cone Field House on Friday, Jan. 21. Carpenter was 7 of 13 from the field and hit 13 of 14 free throws

Women's Soccer: Bearcats find the back of the goal three times, blank Whitworth Jordan Roue (Sr., GK, San Jose, CA/Prospect HS) of Willamette University registered seven saves to lead a strong defensive effort as the Bearcats earned a 3-0 victory over Whitworth University on Sunday, Oct. 24 at Sparks Field. Angelina De Leon (Fy., M, Marana, AZ/Salpointe Catholic HS), Sydney Wilson (Sr., M, Olympia, WA/Capital HS), and Emma Blackburn (Sr., F, Los Altos, CA/Saint Francis HS) each scored a goal for the Bearcats, while Joleigh Miller (Jr., D, Salem, OR/South Salem HS) provided two assists.

Volleyball: Bearcats top Linfield 3-1 Natalie Klotz (Sr., OH, Bonner Springs, KS/Bonner Springs HS) and Olivia Cadien (Fy., OH, Mesa, AZ/Chandler Preparatory Academy) each pounded out 15 kills to lead Willamette University past Linfield University, 3-1, on Wednesday, Sept. 15 in the Northwest Conference opener for both teams. The Bearcats dropped the first set before rallying to win the match at Cone Field House, 17-25, 25-23, 25-20, 25-22.

Bearcat Awards: Jean Williams: Lacey Jones The Jean Williams Award is presented annually to the senior women's student-athlete who most excelled in all areas of their career at Willamette by exemplifying and demonstrating outstanding leadership, scholarship, and athleticism.

Bearcat Awards: Distinguished Service: Don Thomson Sue Rauch gave the bulk of her career and much of her love of life to Willamette University. Not only did she help bring a myriad of students to our school through her work in Admissions; she was also one of Willamette Athletic’s biggest fans. She attended games and was a friend to our coaches over many years. Every year we honor a current staff member whose support extends from the office to the stands in her name.

2021 NCAA Division III LGBTQ Administrator/Coach/Staff of the Year - Hillary Arthur Hillary Arthur, the head women's soccer coach at Willamette University, was named the as the inaugural recipient of the NCAA Division III LGBTQ Administrator/Coach/Staff of the Year.

2020 Athletic Hall of Fame Induction Premieres Sunday at 4pm The 2020 Willamette University Athletic Hall of Fame induction ceremony will premier on Sunday, December 13th at 4pm. 2020 Hall of Fame Inductees: Maddie (Coffman) Lima '09 — cross country/track and field, Katie (Edmonds) Hartman '00 — soccer/basketball, Nikki (Franchi) Kopple '09 — softball, Gary Johnson '77 — football, Kyle Stalker '09 — baseball, 1967-68 Men's Soccer Team

KGW Vault: First woman to play in college football Liz Heaston was the first woman to play in a college football game at Willamette University in Oregon.

My Story Matters NCAA Diversity and Inclusion Social Media Campaign

SECURE Mental health and wellness group for Student-Athletes at Willamette University

Bearcat Awards: Jean Williams: Niki Kates The Jean Williams award is presented annually to the senior women's student-athlete who most exemplifies and demonstrates outstanding leadership, scholarship, and athleticism. It is this well-rounded approach to sports that distinguishes Willamette Athletics. These awards recognize Bearcat student-athletes excelling in all areas of their careers at the University.

Bearcat Awards: J.H. Booth: Derek Ludwig The J.H. Booth award is presented annually to the senior male student-athlete who most exemplifies and demonstrates outstanding leadership, scholarship, and athleticism. It is this well-rounded approach to sports that distinguishes Willamette Athletics. These awards recognize Bearcat student-athletes excelling in all areas of their careers at the University.

Bearcat Awards: Professor of the Year: Lucas Ettinger Julie Abendroth, Ed.D Professor of the Year Award is presented in memory of Professor Abendroth, whose dedication to the student-athletes was not limited to the classroom. She was able to bridge the gap, becoming a mentor and a friend of our student-athletes. Presented by the Willamette University Student-Athlete Advisory Committee to a Willamette University professor demonstrating devotion to the pursuit of excellence by our student-athletes in both academics and athletics.

Bearcat Awards: Alumnus of the Year: Nick Lawson Alumnus of the Year is presented by the Willamette University Coaches in honor of an Alumnus who demonstrates a lifelong connection and commitment to Bearcat Athletics, its coaches, and its student-athletes.

Bearcat Awards: Distinguished Service: Andrea Hugmeyer The Sue J. Rauch Distinguished Service to Athletics award is presented by the Willamette University coaches in memory of Sue Rauch, a dedicated member of the Willamette community, whose ongoing support and commitment served a vital role in the success of the Bearcat Athletics Department, its coaches, and its student-athletes.

Catching up with Coaches: Aaron Swick In this episode of Catching up with Coaches we talk with head baseball coach, Aaron Swick

Catching up with Coaches: Brent Summers In this episode of Catching up with Coaches, we catch up with swim coach Brent Summers.

Catching up with Coaches: Sarah Lautenbach In this episode of Catching up with Coaches, we catch up with head women's lacrosse coach Sarah Lautenbach

Catching up with Coaches: Lily Hallock In the first episode of Catching up with Coaches, we talk with new volleyball head coach Lily Hallock.

National Girls and Women in Sports Day The National Girls and Women in Sports Day is an annual day of observance held during the first week of February to acknowledge the accomplishments of female athletes, recognize the influence of sports participation for women and girls, and honor the progress and continuing struggle for equality for women in sports.

Happy Holidays from Willamette University (LEGO style) As we gather with friends and family to celebrate the wonder of this holiday season, we would like to take a moment to express our deep appreciation for everyone in the Willamette University community. May you take delight in the fun and festivities of the season, and may peace and happiness surround you throughout the coming year. Warmest wishes, President Steve Thorsett Willamette University About Willamette University: www.willamette.edu Admissions: www.willamette.edu/admission The LEGO Waller Hall replica was designed and built by Chuck Williamson, Professor of Chemistry and his son, Owen, in 2013. #WillametteUniversity #WillametteU #LegoStopMotion #legostopmotionanimation #lego #legochristmas #legoholiday lego stop motion animation #legoanimation

Football: #SetTheExpectation The Willamette University football program is proud to join in the efforts of many others on campus by highlighting and supporting Domestic Violence Awareness Month.

Willamette Football Kicking History Kyla Gordon joins Liz Heaston and KayLyn Stirton as Bearcat women who have scored for Willamette Football

2019 Senior Tribute 2019 Bearcat Awards Show Senior Tribute Video

Justus Eaglesmith Justus Eaglesmith talks about his native roots, basketball and how the two have shaped him.

Only at Willamette: BA+MBA in 5 Years Only 10 months out of college, Paimon Jaberi ’17, MBA’18 landed his "dream job" as a business intelligence analyst for the Seahawks and has a full NFL season under his belt. He said Willamette University was the perfect launching pad for his career.

Willamette University Women's Lacrosse Willamette University Women's Lacrosse is building a program and laying a foundation for the future.

Willamette Baseball wins 10-5 over Chapman Highlights from Willamette Baseball's 10-5 win over Chapman in the Spokane Regional of the NCAA DIII Baseball Championships

2018 Senior Tribute 2018 senior tribute video. The 2nd Annual Bearcat Awards were held on May 1, 2018 at Willamette University's Hudson Concert Hall.

Brendon McCullough Why We Play: Brendon McCullough — Willamette student-athletes to talk about what playing a sport has meant to them both here at Willamette and throughout their lives

Kevin Martz Why We Play: Kevin Martz — Willamette student-athletes to talk about what playing a sport has meant to them both here at Willamette and throughout their lives

Morgan Webster Why We Play: Morgan Webster — Willamette student-athletes to talk about what playing a sport has meant to them both here at Willamette and throughout their lives

I Am More Than An Athlete Willamette University Bearcats are more than just athletes.

Willamette Women's Basketball Coaches vs Cancer Willamette University Women's Basketball invites you to support the Coaches vs Cancer 3-point Challenge. The Coaches vs. Cancer 3-Point Challenge is a nationwide program featuring participating college and high school basketball teams. Basketball fans everywhere are encouraged to pledge a donation for each three-point shot their favorite team makes. All proceeds of the 3-Point Challenge support the American Cancer Society. http://3pointchallenge.org

Men's Soccer Coach Lloyd Fobi Men's Soccer Coach Lloyd Fobi after a 1-0 loss to Mary Hardin-Baylor in the first round of the NCAA Division III Championships

2017 #BearcatAiga Pig Roast The Willamette University Athletics staff gathered for an inaugural #BearcatAiga Pig Roast.

2017 SAAC Career Night The Willamette University Student-Athlete Advisory Committee sponsors 2017 Career Night. The annual event features former student-athletes and others with ties to Willamette. They come to network and share their experiences with current Student-Athletes. Bearcats from from Freshmen to Seniors spend the evening talking with professionals from numerous career paths.

Willamette University celebrates 175 Years Happy 175th, Willamette University! Members of the Willamette community recall the past, reflect on the present and envision the future of the university and its students. They also try to pronounce terquasquicentennial, septaquintaquinquecentennial and other tongue-twisting ways to say 175th anniversary.

Women's Basketball hits 19 three pointers The Willamette University Women's Basketball team hit 19 three point shots against Warner Pacific on November 15, 2016.

Alexa Dowdell Senior Night Win Alexa Dowdell ended her collegiate career with a bang. With 22 kills she lead the Bearcats to a 3-2 win over Puget Sound in the final game of the season.

Patrick Loftus 2016 NWC XC Runner-up Patrick Loftus after placing 2nd at the 2016 Northwest Conference Cross Country Championships

Olivia Mancl 2016 NWC XC Champion Olivia Mancl after winning the 2016 Northwest Conference Cross Country Individual Title

2016 Willamette Athletics Senior Tribute 2016 Willamette University Athletics Annual Awards Night — Senior Tribute

Hans Lehndorff — Northwest Conference Discus Champion Senior Hans Lehndorff won the Men's Discus at the 2016 Northwest Conference Track & Field Championships

Hannah Bressler — Northwest Conference Steeplechase Champion Senior Hannah Bressler won the Women's 3000m Steeplechase at the 2016 Northwest Conference Track & Field Championships

Jacob Shafi — Northwest Conference Steeplechase Champion Senior Jacob Shafi won the Men's 3000m Steeplechase at the 2016 Northwest Conference Track & Field Championships

Willamette swim records fall at NWC Championships Several Willamette records were set at the 2016 Northwest Conference Swimming Championships.

Willamette University 2015 in 2:15 A look back at the passing year, reflecting on Willamette's accomplishments.

Red Panda Cubs on Exhibit at Lincoln Park Zoo Chicago (October 22, 2015) - After growing in size and strength, Lincoln Park Zoo’s first-ever red panda cubs Clark (male) and Addison (female) are now on exhibit at Kovler Lion House! The cubs will be on exhibit by 10 a.m. daily.

Lindsey Compton & Sarah Fincher after beating PLU An interview with Lindsey Compton & Sarah Fincher after beating Pacific Lutheran University in 5 sets. The Bearcats improve their record to 6-0 in the Northwest COnference

60 Second Sweep Willamette University Volleyball Sweeps Pacific University... In 60 Seconds

Highlights: Women's Soccer tops Whitman 2-0 I created this video with the YouTube Video Editor (https://www.youtube.com/editor)

Cat Chat 017 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about Division III Week and chat with Senior outfielder Jenna King. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 016 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk with Senior first-baseman Tiras Koon and discuss how track & field differs from team sports. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 015 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. Head rowing coach Reba Knickerbocker gives a primer on her sport and Chris talks with Senior middle distance runner Daniel Swanson. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 014 In this episode Kip Ioane is on assignment so Chris Sabato runs down this past weekend's results. He talks with Gunnar Lee From the Men's Tennis team. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 013 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They wrap up the Men's Basketball Season and talk with Myranda Ramirez from the Softball team. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 012 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk with Women's Basketball Coach Peg Swadener about their big win against Pacific and the search for a new athletics director. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 011 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about swimming at the Northwest Conference Championships and interview Kyle McNally a senior on the men's basketball team. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 010 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about what it will take for Men's Basketball to make the Northwest Conference Tournament and interview Michaela Zuber a junior on the women's swim team. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 009 In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about what you missed since last semester and interview Mark Yuvienco a feshman on the Men's Swim team. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 008 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about Football All-Conference Selections, Dylan Jones and the Gagliardi Trophy and look at what's happening this weekend. This is the last full episode of the year.

Cat Chat 007 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about cross country at the NCAA Championships and look at what's happening this weekend. This week's athlete spotlight is Jojo DeLong from the Women's Basketball team.

Cat Chat 006 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about soccer and volleyball All-Conference selections and look at what's happening this weekend. This episode includes Tracie Nygaard Brockey's speech from halftime of the Bruce Henderson Memorial game.

Cat Chat 005 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about football's big win over Linfield and look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 004 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about Men's Soccer championship scenarios and interview Ryan Kukula a senior on the Men's Golf team. Plus, a look at what's happening this weekend.

Cat Chat 003 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about volleyball and how Willamette streams games. They interview Yazan Hishmeh a Junior on the Men's Soccer team and look at the schedule for this coming weekend.

Cat Chat 002 Cat Chat is a weekly show about Willamette University Bearcat Athletics. In this episode Chris Sabato and Kip Ioane run down this past weekend's results. They talk about Men's Golf and Men's Soccer. They interview Dylan Jones a Senior on the Football team and look at the schedule for this coming weekend.
